body: I'm not positive but I believe I'm running into the same issue.  When I run my tests they all fail with different  errors trying to load assemblies.  The gist of the error messages is: "Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.XXX Version=2.1.0.0'.  The system cannot find the file specified.
I'm having better luck with dotnet vstest, might be worth a go depending on your needs
@SaltyDH - Thanks!  That got things working for me as well.

Same issue here. Will this be fixed? I'm using the `2.1.300-preview2-008533` SDKs with `2.1.0-preview2-26406-04` runtime.

```
Building for framework netcoreapp2.1...
```

```
System.FormatException: Input string was not in a correct format.
   at System.Number.StringToNumber(ReadOnlySpan`1 str, NumberStyles options, NumberBuffer& number, NumberFormatInfo info, Boolean parseDecimal)
   at System.Number.ParseInt32(ReadOnlySpan`1 s, NumberStyles style, NumberFormatInfo info)
   at System.Version.TryParseComponent(ReadOnlySpan`1 component, String componentName, Boolean throwOnFailure, Int32& parsedComponent)
   at System.Version.ParseVersion(ReadOnlySpan`1 input, Boolean throwOnFailure)
   at System.Version.Parse(String input)
   at System.Version..ctor(String version)
   at Program.RunTargetFramework(String testProject, String targetFramework, Boolean amendOutputFileNames) in C:\projects\xunit\src\dotnet-xunit\Program.cs:line 348
   at Program.Execute(String[] args) in C:\projects\xunit\src\dotnet-xunit\Program.cs:line 141
```

issue.title: RavenDB-11003 updated to .NET Core 2.1

body: And same here, running on .NET Core 2.1.0-rc1, dotnet-xunit 2.4.0-beta.1.build3958.

Just tried 2.4.0-beta.2.build3984 from the myget feed, no luck there either.

Any chance on getting a fix out?
We don't have a fix yet (I haven't had time to fix it, and nobody has yet submitted a PR). It will definitely be fixed before another release is shipped.
@bradwilson feel free to cherry-pick my temporary fix for this if it suits your needs: https://github.com/ppekrol/xunit/commit/369d40af4856a6cc083c5b89c290ae3a2c29d4a6
Yeah, that's definitely just a work-around and not a fix, so if someone is doing a PR, it needs a real fix. :)
Unfortunately, due to Microsoft ONLY putting 2.1.0-x versions onto bionic library, I am forced into this test runner that doesn't work.

issue.title: 2.1.0-preview2-26406-04 and xunit 2.3.1 result in Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions not found

repository.name: xunit
repository.description: xUnit.net is a free, open source, community-focused unit testing tool for .NET.

issue.body:
## Steps to reproduce the issue
1. `git clone https://github.com/jsacapdev/k8-ci-cd.git`
2. `cd .\test\KEight.Api.Tests\`
3. `dotnet xunit -c Release`

## Expected behavior

Tests run through to completion

## Actual behavior

```
Detecting target frameworks in KEight.Api.Tests.csproj...
Building for framework netcoreapp2.1...
  You are working with a preview version of the .NET Core SDK. You can define the SDK version via a global.json file in the current project.
 More at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=869452
  You are working with a preview version of the .NET Core SDK. You can define the SDK version via a global.json file in the current project.
 More at https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=869452
  KEight.Data -> C:\git\k8-ci-cd\src\KEight.Data\bin\Release\netstandard2.0\KEight.Data.dll
  KEight.Api -> C:\git\k8-ci-cd\src\KEight.Api\bin\Release\netcoreapp2.1\KEight.Api.dll
  KEight.Api.Tests -> C:\git\k8-ci-cd\test\KEight.Api.Tests\bin\Release\netcoreapp2.1\KEight.Api.Tests.dll
Running .NET Core 2.1.0-preview2-26406-04 tests for framework netcoreapp2.1...
xUnit.net Console Runner (64-bit .NET Core 4.6.26406.07)
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions, Version=2.1.0.0, Culture=neutra
l, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60'. The system cannot find the file specified.
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions, Version=2.1.0.0, Culture=neutra
l, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60'. The system cannot find the file specified.
```

## Additional information (e.g. issue happens only occasionally)

`dotnet test -c Release` works succesfully

## Output of `dotnet --info`


body: FWIW, adding `<RuntimeFrameworkVersion>2.1.0-rc1</RuntimeFrameworkVersion>` to the csproj file of my test project worked for me. Still not a fix, but something an xUnit user can do while waiting for the real fix.
You can test this (without your workaround) by pulling the latest build from [MyGet](https://myget.org/gallery/xunit).
With latest version from MyGet i get `The specified framework 'Microsoft.AspNetCore.All', version '2.1.0-rc1' was not found.` even though version is `2.1.0-rc1-final`.
@cod7alex Please open a new issue with a repro project. Thanks!

issue.title: Needs Unit Tests

repository.name: dwCheckApi
repository.description: An ASP.NET Core WebAPI project for all Discworld novels

issue.body:
Using the xUnit.NET Test template (`dotnet new xunit`) add unit tests for the source code in the `src` directory.

Add the xUnit.NET test library to a directory at the root level (i.e. alongside the `src` directory) called `tests`
